title: Ticket #390: config file should allow expressions in more places
description:
The condor config file only accepts simple literal constants for many settings. Users typically expect Condor to at least evaluate simple expressions. For example, in condor-admin 19217, Igor wanted to do the following, and he was surprised that it did not work. 

REAL_NUM_CPUS = ...
MONITORING_SLOTS = ...
REAL_START_CONDITION = ...

NUM_CPUS = $(REAL_NUM_CPUS) + $(MONITORING_SLOTS)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = $(REAL_NUM_CPUS)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_2 = $(MONITORING_SLOTS)
START = ((SlotID<=$(REAL_NUM_CPUS)) && \
         ($(REAL_START_CONDITION))) \
     || ((SlotID>$(REAL_NUM_CPUS)) && \
         (MonitoringJob=?=True))
